title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.
outcome: Students will be able to demonstrate the skills required to perform a literature review, develop a scientific question, form study hypothesis, discuss study methods and data analysis for the research project(s) under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s)
syllabus: Supervisors will provide guidance to students on research project, presentations and thesis writing. Students will gain a deeper understanding of the subject area and will develop analytical, problem solving and research skills. Activities may include written reports, attendance in research group meetings and presentations of research topics and skills related to their topic area as determined by the supervisor.

instructors:
Professor CHEN Huarong, 

Professor CHU Hiu Man, 

Professor LING Lo Well Lowell, 

Professor LIU Xiaodong, 

Professor TAN Likai, 

Professor WONG Man Kin, 

Professor WU Ka Kei, 

Professor ZHANG Lin

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledgeof the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.

title: Seminar
requirements: For students in MPhil Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous term/year.
outcome: Students will be able to present his/her research project(s), with a literature review, study background, scientific questions and hypothesis, methods, results and discussion.
syllabus: You will present a 30-minute presentation with a Q & A section at a research meeting related to your research topic area as assigned by the supervisor. You will attend and participate in the discussion of presentations at seminars.

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in PhD Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.
outcome: Students will be able to demonstrate the skills required to perform a detailed literature review to identify knowledge gaps in the literature, design research project(s), propose study methods and data analysis, and interpret the results under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s)
syllabus: Supervisors will provide guidance to students on research project, presentations and thesis writing. Students will gain a deeper understanding of the subject area and will develop analytical, problem solving and research skills. Activities may include written reports, attendance in research group meetings and presentations of research topics and skills related to their topic area as determined by the supervisor.

description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.

syllabus: Supervisors will provide guidance to students on research project, presentations and thesis writing. title: Seminar
requirements: For students in PhD Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous term/year.
outcome: Students will be able to present his/her research project(s), with a detailed literature review, introduction, study hypothesis and aims, methods and data analysis, results and discussion. Such endeavours should enable a student to present his/her work at a local, regional or international conference(s).
syllabus: You will present a 30-minute presentation with a Q & A section at a research meeting related to your research topic area as assigned by the supervisor. You will attend and participate in the discussion of presentations at seminars.

title: Research
requirements: For students in MPhil Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To conduct clinical or laboratory-based research work on the assigned research topic.

title: Research
requirements: For students in MPhil Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To conduct clinical or laboratory-based research work on the assigned research topic.
outcome: Students will be able to perform a literature review and conduct his/her research project(s) under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s)
syllabus: You will develop and conduct research projects assigned and approved by supervisor. Supervisors will provide guidance on study design, methodology, data analysis and interpretation. Students will discuss research plan and report on research progress during the semester.

title: Research

title: Research
requirements: For students in PhD Anaesthesia and Intensive Care
description: To conduct clinical or laboratory-based research work on the assigned research topic.
outcome: Students will be able to independently perform a detailed literature review and conduct original research project(s) under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s). Such endeavours should produce a paper to a publishable standard in a peer-review journal
syllabus: You will develop and conduct research projects assigned and approved by supervisor. Supervisors will provide guidance on study design, methodology, data analysis and interpretation. Students will discuss research plan and report on research progress during the semester.
